title: In Trump’s America, Dr. King's family is working to build unity
shortDescription: As the president wages a war on DEI and threatens to roll back other civil rights efforts, the King family is continuing the Nobel laureate's mission.

title: Gov. Whitmer says Trump promised not to pardon kidnapping plotters
shortDescription: In a radio interview, Gov. Whitmer said Trump told her he would "drop" the idea of pardoning men convicted of conspiring to kidnap her in 2020.

title: Trump slams Federalist Society, judges who ruled against his tariffs
shortDescription: The Federalist Society is a pillar of the conservative legal movement that once advised Trump on judicial picks. Now he's slamming the group.

title: Trump taps Paul Ingrassia to head U.S. Office of Special Counsel
shortDescription: The office investigates and prosecutes allegations of retaliation for whistleblowing among other things.

title: White House address MAHA commission report errors
shortDescription: The White House addressed the errors in the HHS's "Make America Healthy Again" commission report, but researchers are pushing back.

title: Musk's exit: from Trump's chainsaw-wielding sidekick to suddenly gone
shortDescription: Elon Musk has left the White House with little fanfare after splitting with Trump on policy and failing to meet his DOGE savings goals.

title: Tanks a lot: DC mayor fears Trump-Army parade will damage city streets
shortDescription: The Army said it would cover the cost of any damage to Washington, D.C.'s streets from its June 14 parade. Mayor Muriel Bowser is still worried.

title: Leavitt blasts Jill Biden over husband's health 'coverup'
shortDescription: The Trump White House's Karoline Leavitt said former first lady Jill Biden should address 'when she saw and what she knew' about her husband's health.

title: DC metro to 'Trump Train': Latest renaming efforts by Republicans
shortDescription: A congressman wants to rename D.C.'s Metro the "Trump Train," the latest GOP effort to attach the president's name to major infrastructure.

title: Appeals court rules Trump can impose tariffs for now
shortDescription: A U.S. trade court blocked Trump's tariffs May 28, but the president quickly appealed.

title: Appeals court allows Trump tariffs pending appeal
shortDescription: An appeals court ruled the Trump administration will be allowed to levy tariffs while an appeal on previous court rulings plays out.

title: Deaf Americans sue Trump over loss of ASL translators at briefings
shortDescription: A 2020 court ruling mandated the White House provide real-time translations via American Sign Language. President Trump halted their use in January.

title: Trump meets with Fed chair after criticizing him on interest rates
shortDescription: Trump has pressured the Fed chair to lower interest rates. They met at the White House May 29.

title: Judge blocks Trump's Harvard foreign student ban
shortDescription: A federal judge extended an order to block the Trump administration from revoking foreign students to Harvard University.

title: What is ‘TACO trade,’ a new phrase angering Trump?
shortDescription: 'TACO trade' is a jab at President Donald Trump’s propensity to impose or threaten tariffs and later back off.

title: Second federal court blocks Trump tariffs - for Illinois toy importers
shortDescription: A federal judge blocked Trump's tariffs for a pair of Illinois toy importers, the second ruling against the tariffs in as many days.

title: Trump pardons rapper NBA YoungBoy in spree of clemency actions
shortDescription: President Trump pardoned NBA YoungBoy in spree of reprieves that included one for a reality television couple and a notorious former gang leader.

title: Trump to appeal court rulings overturning most tariffs: What to know
shortDescription: The White House called for the Supreme Court to overturn judicial rulings blocking most of the tariffs Trump has imposed to negotiate trade agreements.

title: Trump briefly retreats on Harvard student ban, as judge backs campus
shortDescription: A federal judge plans to issue a preliminary injunction blocking the Trump administration from halting Harvard's ability to enroll foreign students.

title: Nine provisions lurking in Trump's tax bill you need to know about
shortDescription: These provisions may not have top billing in the sweeping GOP tax bill, but they could have a big impact on Americans' everyday lives.

title: Trump commutes former Chicago gang leader's sentence. Who is Larry Hoover?
shortDescription: Former gang leader Larry Hoover, who attracted support from celebrity rappers, is one of several people who had sentences commuted by Trump on May 28.

title: Sen. Rand Paul calls GOP spending cuts 'wimpy'
shortDescription: Sen. Rand Paul, a vocal critic of the Trump-backed budget bill he said has "wimpy" spending cuts, advocated to shift more Medicaid spending to states.

title: Trade court blocks Trump's tariffs | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: Elon Musk leaves the Trump administration. | What is the Trump-Vance approach to crypto? | Oklahoma City Thunder are in the NBA Finals.

title: Iowa GOP lawmaker defends Trump tax bill amid town hall heckling
shortDescription: Iowa Republican Rep. Ashley Hinson faced a deluge of boos and shouts at two town halls over President Donald Trump's sweeping tax and policy bill.

title: Elon Musk leaves Trump administration
shortDescription: Elon Musk is leaving the Trump administration as his allotted 130 days as a "special government employee" ends.

title: Trump pardons governor convicted of corruption, rapper NBA YoungBoy
shortDescription: Trump pardoned NBA YoungBoy, a Louisiana-born rapper, and John Rowland, the former GOP governor of Connecticut.

title: Daily Briefing: Trump can't use a 1977 law to impose tariffs
shortDescription: Federal court hands the president's economic policy a major setback. Here is the news to know on Thursday.

title: Trump pardons former congressman Michael Grimm
shortDescription: Former Republican Congressman Michael Grimm has received a presidential pardon from Donald Trump, according to the White House.

title: Religious colleges get break in Trump bill as war with Harvard rages
shortDescription: Trump's spending bill, now headed to the Senate, would exempt religious colleges from a big tax increase on endowments.
